oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Development of the First Menthane-Based Chiral Bis(p-allylpalladium) Catalysis: Asymmetric Allylation of Imines
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: FERNANDES, RA
CHAUDHARI, DA
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Asymmetric catalysis
Homogeneous catalysis
C-C coupling
Allyl-ation
Palladium
Enantioselectivity
PI-ALLYLPALLADIUM COMPLEX
HIGHLY STEREOSELECTIVE-SYNTHESIS
HOMOALLYLIC AMINES
ENANTIOSELECTIVE ALLYLATION
ORGANOMETALLIC REAGENTS
N-ACYLHYDRAZONES
METAL-COMPOUNDS
PALLADIUM
ALLYLTRICHLOROSILANES
BUTADIENE
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A new ethylidene menthane-based chiral p-allylpalladium complex catalyzes the asymmetric allylation of various imines with allyltributylstannane and 1 equiv. of water to give chiral homoallylamines in good yields and enantioselectivities. The reaction was carried out essentially under neutral conditions and displayed a good transfer of chiral information from the menthane skeleton through the formation of a bis(p-allylpalladium) species. This is the first example of menthane-based chiral bis(p-allylpalladium) catalysis.
